choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
Harmony used discarded paper to make notepads for her friends. She would fold five letter size pieces of paper three times then cut along the lines. She would then stack the smaller note papers and staple them together. How long would one notepad last if someone wrote ten notes per day?

### Response:


To make a single 5-letter sized piece of paper, Harmoney needs to fold it three times along its length using her hands or by rolling the paper over itself and twisting. Once folded, she can cut off one side with scissors while holding onto another edge for support. 

Once all five pieces are in place, Harmoney will stack them on top of each other to create a single note pad that is 15 cm long by the width of an A4 paper (210 mm x 297 mm). The notes can be written inside using pencils or crayons. 

To write ten notes per day, Harmoney would need at least one sheet of paper for each person she wants to keep track of and a pen/pencil for writing on the note pad. She could use her hands to fold up these sheets as well if needed.
